projects: [{"title":"NLP based Legal Search Engine ","start_date":"Mar 2019","description":"•Part of the team which won a Gold medal among 15 other teams in the Inter-Hall Opensoft Competition, 2019 for making NLP based Legal Search Engine for lawyers and also for the common man so that they can search past 53000 supreme court cases.•Relevant results were obtained using the Okapi BM25 searching and ranking algorithm. The results can also be filtered according to the Judge's name, Date of the judgment, type of case, etc.•Integrated modules such as Spell-Checker (Peter Norvig's Algorithm), Abbreviation handler, automatic summarization in the application.•Was offered a research project under Prof. Saptarshi Ghosh, Department of Computer Science and Engineering."},{},{},{},{},{},{"title":"Digitalising doctor's handwritten prescription using OpenCV","start_date":"Mar 2017","description":"•Built a python based application which digitalizes doctor's handwritten prescription using OpenCV for preprocessing and Microsoft Azure Vision API for text recognition(OCR).•Conceptualized an error correction algorithm that corrects the detected words using a medical dictionary that maps medicines to symptoms of a disease.•Achieved an accuracy of 74.3 % which is significantly higher than Vision API's accuracy."},{},{},{"title":"Image Super Resolution using Convolutional Autoencoders","start_date":"May 2020","end_date":"May 2020","description":"Developed an algorithm which increases the resolution of blurry/grainy images using Convolutional Autoencoders. Used skip connections between the encoder and decoder to maintain the information passed."},{"title":"Hierarchical Clustering : Customer Segmentation","start_date":"Apr 2020","end_date":"Apr 2020"},{"title":"Human Surveillance System using Deep Learning ","start_date":"May 2019","end_date":"Jul 2019","description":"Project Guide: Prof. Aurobinda Routray, Department of Electrical Engineering•Developed a python based human surveillance system for public places like retail stores.•The system calculates the time spent by the person and also the change in the expression of the person at the entry and exit.•ResNet model was used for face recognition and the Inception model was used to calculate the 128-dimensional facial embedding.•A happiness index was introduced to calculate the happiness of the person at entry and also at the exit."},{"title":"Hypothermia prevention jacket","start_date":"Jul 2017","end_date":"Aug 2017","description":"•Part of the team which won Gold medal among 12+ teams in Open IIT Product Design competition.•Designed a jacket that prevents the condition of Hypothermia which wreaks havoc in the community of mountain climbers and the army men.•Ideated the use of heat packs made up of the reaction between supercooled Sodium carbonate and water, which was exothermic in nature. •Integrated features such as GPS locater, emergency SOS caller which made our product efficient and also one of it's kind."},{},{}]
